quiz_questions.q: What's the difference between CIO (Information) and CIO (Investment)?
quiz_questions.a: Chief Information Officer handles IT/data systems; Chief Investment Officer handles financial investments

quiz_questions.q: What are the three possible meanings of CCO?
quiz_questions.a: Chief Commercial Officer, Chief Communication Officer, Chief Content Officer
quiz_questions.explanation: Context determines which CCO is meant

quiz_questions.q: Where does 'Chief of Staff' fit in the hierarchy?
quiz_questions.a: Tier 6 - Support level, below Team Leaders
quiz_questions.explanation: Despite 'Chief' in title, it's a support role

quiz_questions.q: What's the difference between CTO and CIO?
quiz_questions.a: CTO focuses on technology/product development; CIO focuses on information systems/IT infrastructure
quiz_questions.explanation: CTO builds tech products, CIO manages tech operations

quiz_questions.q: What level is 'Managing Director' equivalent to?
quiz_questions.a: Tier 3 - Same level as Senior Vice President
quiz_questions.explanation: Different companies use different titles for same level
